job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Cambridge, MA
pros: The atmosphere fostered at JJPI is one of professionalism, collaboration, support, and mutual respect. The co-workers and supervision you receive make JJPI a great place to work and grow as a clinician.
cons: The job is very paperwork heavy, and it is fee-for-service, so you only get paid for time spent with clients.

pros: support from management and flexible work hours
cons: low salary, inconsistent language from management about pay scales

job_title: Fee for Service Clinician in Phila, PA
pros: I have really enjoyed working with this organization
cons: Case loads can be overwhelming sometiems.

review_title: Very friendly and helpful staff. I have been here for just over a month and have not enjoyed a job more than this one.
pros: The work that JJPI is doing is very rewarding and honorable. The staff is very personable and works together as a team. The Executive Director is a great boss and really takes care of his employees. There are a lot of exciting changes happening to only better the organization and its services to the public.
cons: The on-boarding process was a bit frustrating but that was due to PHMC not JJPI directly.

review_title: JJPI provided tons of experience yet decreases tons of morale.
pros: Your able to communicate with individuals with similar interests as you and assist in bettering the community through offering top quality therapy.
cons: Disrespect towards employers, poor morale, minimal resources and poor management.

pros: It may be that other units function well and still have a good reputation
cons: The partial hospital program for sex offenders is abysmal, both adult and adolescent.

pros: Great colleagues and clients are responsive to treatment modules

Benefits
Pay was ok for what the job was
The idea of working with sex offenders is scary but it wasn't
cons: Working for the partial program was hell, don't do it. 10+ amazing people have left in the last few months
